doc.title: Solution Architecture
doc.snippet: Fields: userId, name, type, balance, currency, isDefault, isDeleted, createdAt, updatedAt. Editable: name, type only. Protected: balance (transaction-controlled), currency (immutable), isDefault (separate flow)

story-context.constraints: - CRITICAL: Never modify balance, currency, isDefault, isDeleted, or createdAt fields during edit operations - CRITICAL: All account edits must preserve transaction history - transactions remain linked via accountId - Multi-step conversation flow requires conversation state management (new pattern for this project) - Name uniqueness must be case-insensitive and exclude the current account being edited - Edit operations must update updatedAt timestamp but preserve createdAt - Confirmation required before applying any changes (follows established pattern from story 2.1) - User can cancel at any step - must clean up conversation state and pending actions - If editing default account, maintain isDefault=true (separate story will handle transferring default status) - All messages in the edit flow must be stored in messages table for conversation history - Performance target: Complete edit flow in < 5 seconds end-to-end - Bilingual support: All prompts, menus, and confirmations must work in Arabic and English - Error messages must be clear and actionable in user's preferred language

interface.name: accounts.update
interface.signature: update(userId: Id<users>, accountId: Id<accounts>, updates: { name?: string, type?: AccountType }): Promise<Account>
interface.description: Core mutation for updating account name and/or type. Validates user ownership, name uniqueness, and field constraints. Returns updated account object.

interface.name: accounts.getById
interface.description: Retrieves account by ID. Used to fetch current account details before editing and to validate user ownership.

interface.name: accounts.getByName
interface.signature: getByName(userId: Id<users>, name: string): Promise<Account | null>
interface.description: Case-insensitive name lookup for duplicate prevention. Must exclude current account when validating new name.

interface.name: accounts.list
interface.description: Returns all active accounts for user. Used in account selection flow when user has multiple accounts.

interface.name: ai.nlParser.parseAccountIntent
interface.description: Detects edit_account intent and extracts entities. Must be extended to support edit_account intent with optional entities: accountId, accountName, newName, newType.

interface.name: conversationStates.set
interface.signature: set(userId: Id<users>, stateType: string, stateData: any, expiresAt: number): Promise<Id<conversationStates>>
interface.description: NEW - Stores conversation state for multi-step flows. State types: "awaiting_account_name", "awaiting_account_selection". Expires after 10 minutes.

interface.name: conversationStates.get
interface.description: NEW - Retrieves active conversation state for user. Returns null if no active state or state expired.

interface.name: conversationStates.clear
interface.description: NEW - Clears conversation state after completion or cancellation. Called when edit flow completes or user cancels.

interface.name: pendingActions.createPending
interface.signature: createPending(userId: Id<users>, actionType: string, actionData: any, messageId: number): Promise<Id<pendingActions>>
interface.description: Stores pending confirmation with 5-minute expiration. Action types: "confirm_edit_name", "confirm_edit_type".

interface.name: telegram.sendMessage
interface.signature: sendMessage(chatId: string, text: string, options?: { reply_markup?: InlineKeyboard }): Promise<Message>
interface.description: Sends message to user via Telegram Bot API. Used for prompts, confirmations, and success messages throughout edit flow.
